description.text: Welcome to the next season of Vault Hunters!
This modpack is still Vault Hunters 3rd Edition at it's core, but we have made many changes to the base pack.
With all the new changes to the pack, we have done our best to include

where needed to help provide small tidbits of information on different things. This quest line can also serve as a place to get information as we've added new quests and made some changes to existing ones.

Before you start playing, make sure to set your game difficulty to suit how you want to play.  Normal is the default difficulty and if you don't want to play on normal, you can change your difficulty at anytime via command by typing

.

The different difficulties from easiest to hardest are:

.

In addition to different difficulties, you can also select your gamemode. Vault Hunters features three game modes; Normal, Casual and Hardcore with Normal being the default gamemode. Your gamemode can be set using the /gamerule vaultMode.
- death after level twenty causes a spirit to spawn at your spawn point, using a spirit extractor you can buy back your lost items
- death after level twenty does not cause item loss, you just take some durability damage instead
- death after level twenty causes permanent loss of items and inventory
will invite friends to your party so you can vault together and see each others health.
will group players into a team so that they can work on their researches together.
There is an active worldborder on the server and it can be expanded with the help of two items.

:
Power Crystals are found commonly in
and are to be submitted to the
at spawn. Upon submission the border will be expanded 1 block per crystal (2 diameter).
: You can also submit these crystals stacks at a time

:
The Globe Expander will sit at spawn and accept
. If you are curious about the current size of the world border, you can right click on the block with an empty hand.
Submit a Power Gem to the Globe Expander
As you explore the world, you will notice naturally spawning portal frames. Every now and then, these portals will become active and a message will appear in chat that looks like the following:
You sense that a mysterious energy is resonating in

.

These portals can appear in all 3 main Minecraft dimensions, but the coordinates in the message will be partially hidden giving you only hints to it's location!

Once you have found the portal, you can enter to experience one of many different vault types each with their own sets of modifiers.
Oh and by the way...sometimes if a portal is open for too long....mobs and even bosses may leak from the portal. Surely this isn't that big of an issue....right?
One of the mods that we have added is
. This mod is an addon to Vault Hunters made by the man, the myth, the legend

himself.

This mod adds new vault gear, vault objectives, vault crafting ingredients, loot boxes, and much more.
to help provide information on all the new things.
The first step in your journey as a Vault Hunter is to find the
is found in the deepest part of your world, below
. It can be mined with an
and fortuned to increase your yield!
The next step to your adventure is finding
. You might have come across this very dark stone already while looking for Chromatic Iron, as it can be found anywhere below
without silk touch, there is a chance to get a
, make sure to not throw these away as they are the key to enter a vault!
itself is a very sturdy material used for many different things, but perhaps most importantly used to make your vault portals!
Now it's time to craft your Vault Altar, placing your vault rock on your Vault Altar is how you obtain your recipe for crafting a Vault Crystal
Don't like your current altar recipe?  With the

, you can re-roll your recipe by sneaking and right clicking on the vault altar with the recatalyzer in hand.

This also works with the Lucky Altar expertise, so it's entirely possible to get a free recipe.

The time has come to forge your first Vault Crystal! Every recipe is different and the amount of required ingredients will slowly scale up as you craft more crystals.

Using a Vault Rock on a Vault Altar will identify the items required to complete the crystal recipe. You can submit items to the altar by throwing them out of your inventory near the altar. Once the altar recipe is finished, applying a redstone signal completes the crafting process.

If you struggle to tell what an item is you can crouch to view its name.

Before you get in to your first vault, we want to inform you about a few important parts of Vault Hunters. Vault Hunters has an in-depth Ability and Talent system that you will utilise to make your Vault experience much more enjoyable.

Abilities typically focus on giving you powerful active skills that significantly change how you play the game; ranging from damaging abilities like Nova or Rampage, healing abilities like Heal and Totem and survivability abilities such as Dash and Ghost Walk.

Talents provide the player with passive buffs. There is a wide variety of Talents to check out, each built to level up specific aspects of your experience.

Check the Vault UI by pressing 'H' by default and click on the second and third tabs at the top to view Abilities and Talents respectively.

Your reward for this quest is
, it's highly recommended to take the
if this is your first time playing as there is no natural health regeneration in the vaults

In Vault Hunters, Enchantments are a bit different than in Vanilla Minecraft. Protection and Offensive enchantments have been disabled, in order to allow higher scaling of defensive and offensive attributes down the line. There are however some enchantments that work both on vanilla tools and gear, as well as vault tools and gear.

The Vault Enchanter is your go to table for enchanting any gear or tools, it will always offer the max available enchantment for the cost of some emeralds and xp, craft one and try to put any enchantable item in it.
Vault potions are an out of combat alternative to the

.
They are the only type of potion that doesn't anger

inside the vaults!

Vault Potions have a set amount of

to be used each vault, completely refilling itself once you have exited a vault.
Starting out you have access to the

tier of potions, later in your adventure you will have the possibility to research better tiers, granting you bigger heals with each charge.
When crafting your first Potion (
) you get to make the choice between 3 different recharge mechanics;
, which recharges your vial when killing a certain amount of mobs
, which recharges your vial when looting a certain amount of chests

, which recharges your vial passively over time

Don't worry though, you can craft them all and see which fits you the best, but you can only ever use one per vault!

Looting in vaults is fun, and there are a lot of exciting things to find!
Gear stats like
increases the amount of loot you find while
makes you find higher tier loot.
In addition to chests having loot, killing mobs will yield
, which can be used to purchase rare items in the

.
However, all of this loot can quickly become overwhelming, and any good hunter needs good loot organisation!
Shulker Boxes can go a long way in the beginning, and their shells can be found inside
is a much better and more reliable way to collect your loot.
The first pouch of your journey is on us, but we do recommend crafting more as you progress. Bigger pouches, belts and backpacks can later be researched for
Pouches can be upgraded with upgrade cards to make them carry more loot, automatically pick up loot when you break a chest, void excess loot and even feed you!

The pouch itself can also be configured with a filter, or left empty to fit any items.
To configure a filter, open your pouch and browse to the

tab allows you to set a filter for your pouch to either whitelist or blacklist certain content to go inside it. These filters can also be saved and reapplied to other pouches later on. We recommend you play around with these settings until you understand the system.
Completing this quest will reward you with two basic upgrades, which can both be installed in your pouch:
which will make the pouch automatically pick up items from the floor, when a chest is broken or items are thrown out of it

which can be configured to void (delete) any excess items that can't fit in your pouch. Voiding items may sound weird, but can be extremely useful to improve your early game looting. These are expensive to craft however, so use the one from this quest wisely!
, the items dropped from mobs, are better to store in a

. The Shard Pouch can only store Soul Shards, but an infinite amount of them as long as it is in your inventory. It can also be left in your inventory while purchasing things from the Black Market, without you having to manually count Soul Shards, it is a must have for any hunter!

Unlike normal Vault Hunters, coin pouches exist. Like the name says, the coin pouch can store a mass amount of coins. This pouch acts as a compacting drawer and automatically converts platinum to bronze and visa versa.
The coin pouch can be equipped in a curios slot and can also have

Completing bounties is a great way to secure yourself some extra loot and give yourself a solid goal to work towards. You will first need to craft yourself a Bounty Table and then interact with it by right-clicking it.

Inside the Bounty Table you can select a bounty by clicking on one of the available bounties and clicking activate. Once you complete a bounty then you can go back to the table and collect your rewards.
The Tool Station can be used to craft tools that are able to significantly enhance your experience in the vaults. It can also be used to craft jewels that can be applied to your vault tool
Vault Tools are the successor to vanilla tools. These can be modified with jewels to apply new affinities and traits to the tool.
Affinities allow you to break chests/coins at a significantly faster speed enabling you to instantly mine all coins and chests apart from wooden ones.

There are also jewels that can change the tools functionality to include that of another. For example you could put a Shovelling jewel on a Pick to create a Mattock that can mine as fast as a pickaxe and dig as quick as a shovel!
There are also more modifiers that enhance your tool significantly:
both enhance your tool with higher loot capabilities.
has a chance to disarm a trapped chest inside the Vaults.
increases base mining speed of your tool!
adds a chance to double the output of a mined Vault Ore inside the vaults! Works with Silk Touch and Fortune.
increases the base Durability of the tool

both change the tool to have special interactions. Pulverizing acts as a basic Tool based replacement to pulverizing/crushing processing the output of the block that is mined. Smelting will smelt the output of the block that is mined!
can be applied to Hammers to increase their mining AOE
makes a tool stay in your inventory even through death!
applies a chance for your tool to not take durability outside of vaults. At 100% it will make your tool unbreakable!
increases the range at which the player can interact with blocks.
The Jewel Applicator makes applying jewels to you tools as simple as ever by providing you with the means of easily seeing the outcome of your Tool.

The Jewel Applicator has three parts of its inventory; 
The

is where you can put your jewels, showing you the total outcome of if they were placed on your tool. 
The

is where you place your tool and can also see the visual output of combining tool type jewels like shovelling or axing for example. 
Lastly, the
will show you the updated stats using the jewels placed on the left side, automatically calculating capacity and all your prefixes and suffixes as you place jewels into the Applicator
and this decides how much of the
of your Tool will be used up.

Build yourself a Vault Portal with any assortment of Vault Stone blocks in a similar fashion to the Nether Portal. Once the portal is built then you can right-click your Vault Crystal onto the frame to open a Portal.

There is a time limit within the Vault, requiring you to complete it before it ticks down to 0. Marking your way with blocks will allow you to easily find your way back to your portal.

If you die you will return to the overworld and if you are under vault level 20 you will be granted 'Beginners Grace' which will allow you to keep all your loot regardless of dying or escaping.

If you manage to complete the Vault you will be granted a Crate that can be placed and then Sneak+Right-Clicked to open!
The Vault trident is a new piece of vault gear that is similar to vanilla tridents but instead of enchanting to obtain
, they will roll as implicits instead.
are mutually exclusive and cannot roll alongside one another, but

can roll alongside either of the two.

Keep in mind that vault tridents may be used as a melee weapon, but will do twice the damage when thrown.
works a little different than it's vanilla counterpart. You will need the

on the trident to gain a chance of triggering the effect.  When successful, lightning will strike with a chance to proc any effect clouds and do twice the damage of a thrown trident to those hit with the bolt.
The Vault Battlestaff is a new piece of vault gear that is also used in the main hand. Vault Battlestaffs can roll many implicits and are the best when it comes to raw base

.

Unfortunately because of this high rate of attack, battlestaffs will do a bit less damage than a normal Vault Sword.

Expertises are gained by spending Expertise Points which are obtained every 5 levels. Expertises are similar to Talents providing passive buffs to the player, however these are targeted towards more specific use cases such as Fortunate which can add two additional Fortune levels to the player or Angel which allows you to craft an Angel Block which provides creative flight in a 64 block radius around it.

There are a total of twenty expertise points to be acquired through your playthrough and due to their utility they are not as easy to reset, requiring a Neuralizer rather than a regret orb.

The Vault Forge is used to craft gear and weapons as well as powerful trinkets once they have been unlocked. Crafting gear increases proficiency further honing your skills at forging specific types of gear.

Magnets suck up loot within a radius of the player! They synergise exceptionally with Affinities/Breaking chests within the vault and can speed up your looting significantly. Magnets also have modifiers that can be applied to enhance their strengths.

To equip a Magnet, press the Curios button that is next to your helmet slot within your inventory and place the magnet in the Belt slot!
Forge a Magnet in the Vault Forge

The Artisan Station can be used to further modify and create gear that is suited towards a certain build style. The interface has slots for Vault Plating, Vault Bronze, A wide variety of differently functioning focuses and your Vault Gear.
Rerolling and modifying gear is a very important part of Vault Hunters and it all starts with placing

into an Artisan Station.

There are many foci that you will obtain throughout your playthrough and they will be introduced accordingly, but the three main and 1 additional
that are important are the following.
: This focus will re-roll all prefixes and suffixes.
: This focus will randomly add a prefix or suffix to an empty slot.
: This focus will randomly remove a prefix or suffix.
: This focus will ensure you get a specific modifier while re-rolling all prefixes and suffixes.
Clicking the Reforge button next to the desired focus will apply new modifiers onto your gear/weapon. This is the starting steps to creating gear fit for your build style
Reroll a Gear Piece with a Wild Focus
The Vault Recycler is used to break down old and unwanted gear into Vault Scrap, Wild Focuses and Faceted Focuses. It can also be used to break down and recycle Jewels, Magnets and Inscriptions!
is a very useful table. It allows you to modify your

to your charges!

Some of these
have to be unlocked, which you will learn about later, but a handful are

already now. 
One effect can be added per potion, and their strength

As you level up, the Vault will adapt and present you with new, more challenging Objectives; these can also be added to your crystal by crafting a Seal and applying it to your crystal in an anvil. 

Level 10 marks the introduction of the Light the Brazier Objective to random vaults.
Level 20 marks the introduction of the Scavenger Objective to random vaults.
Level 40 marks the introduction of the Hunt the Guardians Objective to random vaults.
Level 50 marks the introduction of the Bingo objective to random vaults.

It can be rather stressful to make decisions when it comes to which abilities and what talents to take throughout your playthrough, but, don't stress!

Vault Hunters have a mechanic for regretting your decisions using
. Consuming a Regret Orb will give you an unspent regret point, which can be used to unlearn talents or abilities.
To craft a Regret Orb you need
. Fully completed Regret Orbs can also be obtained through

The black market has changed a little bit

The black market starts with 3 slots and can be expanded to a total of 6 slots by using the

expertise.

Soul shards are still the currency, but re-rolling now takes

The Soul Diffuser breaks down vault items into soul dust which can then be turned into Soul Shards to be used as a currency for the Black Market. This gives you the choice of deciding what you deem valuable and what you deem worthy of diffusing!
The Identification Stand is a block that when right clicked on will
all unidentified vault gear in your inventory instantly.

Obtaining and using Knowledge Stars is one of the key aspects to the Vault Hunters progression as it is the key component to unlocking new mods. Pressing the 'H' Key and selecting the Researches tab at the top will show you all the stuff you can unlock. Note that purchasing some of these will increase the price of subsequent unlocks within that group of unlocks.

Your reward for this quest is a Mod Box! When used, the Mod Box awards a random item from your unlocked mods
Reaching level 20 marks the end of the tutorial stage of Vault Hunters!
dying in a vault no longer keeps your items, you will learn more about that in the
A lot of new things happen at this level, you will now find
inside the vault, as well as additional loot and new mobs!
Don't worry though, you've only just begun!

Seals are especially handy items as they let you set the objective of the vault. This way even if you are lower level you will be able to play any objective at any time. To use a seal apply it to a crystal in a anvil or in the crystal workbench
objective to a crystal. To craft it you will need a blank seal and a few vault ingredients
The Elixir objective requires you to get a certain amount of elixir by looting chests, slaying mobs or mining ore. Once you fill up your elixir bar find a lodestone to exit the vault
This objective has a recommended level of 0 and will randomly appear in the vaults as well after that level.
Acquire a Seal of the Sage
objective to a crystal. To craft it you will need a blank seal and a few vault ingredients

The Light the Brazier objective requires you to find braziers and light them. These braziers will have positive and negative effects attached to them so choose carefully. After you have lit all the braziers you can choose to leave through the vault portal or pillage more braziers for additional loot!
This objective has a recommended level of 10+ and will randomly appear in the vaults as well after that level.
Acquire a Seal of the Scout
objective to a crystal. To craft it you will need a blank seal and a few vault ingredients
We also recommend you make a extra pouch just for scav items, commonly refered to as a
. This will make organising your scav items a lot easier! Another good thing to know is that when you exit the vaults the scav items become
. Rotten scav items can't be used in another scav vault. They can be however smelted down into soul dust in the soul harvester.

The Scavenger objective requires you to find a certain list of items displayed at the top of your screen. You can see where you would get the items from by looking at the icons under the items, Once you have collected all items deposit them into a scavenger altar!
This objective has a recommended level of 20+ and will randomly appear in the vaults as well after that level.
Acquire a Seal of the Hunter
in order to suit your current needs, or preferences. There are several different modifications that can be done to a crystal.
sets the theme of the vault, these are found ever so often in completion crates.
gives the vault a buff, depending on what capstone is used, and then makes the vault unmodifiable

adds modifiers to the vault, modifiers can for example increase the amount of a specific chest, while also making the vault slightly harder by adding a random negative modifier, for example one that buffs the mobs inside the vault.
adds a specific room somewhere inside the vault, for each inscription added.
the vault to your liking. Each crystal has a
, the higher level you are, the higher capacity the crystal have. You can exceed the capacity of a crystal, but every time you do, you will add a

to the vault!

All modifications to a crystal are done in the
on your vault crystals can heavily improve the loot that you are looking for!

can for example increase the amount of a specific chest, while also making the vault slightly harder by adding a random negative modifier, for example one that buffs the strength of the mobs inside the vault.
on a vault crystal, catalysts with less size requirement can be found rarely in treasure rooms and completion crates.
can be applied to a crystal in the
on your vault crystals can give you many advantages, as it allows you to create a vault
of a crystal, inscriptions with less size requirement can be found rarely in Living Chests, Treasure Rooms and Completion Crates.
can be applied to a crystal in the
, when a crystal has at least 1 inscription inscribed on it, the vault will
of where to find that room in the start room. Take your time to memorise the path to the room(s) and then head out to find them!
The goal for any hunter is to complete the infamous Artifact Puzzle, and to fight the legendary Herald!
, after level 20. The chance of finding an Artifact gets higher the higher level your vault is when you complete it.
There are 25 unique artifacts to collect, and in order to gain access to
you need to collect all of them!
will display the puzzle above it, and artifacts can be placed in their correct spot to complete the puzzle.
While hunting for Artifacts you will most likely come across duplicates. These can be
in order to burn in to a
which can be used to craft a new Artifact.

The Spirit Extractor is used to recover loot lost within vaults. If you die, pick up your spirit by Sneak+Right-Clicking it and place it onto the Extractor by Right-Clicking it. This will give you a price in Vault Gold that you will have to pay in order to recieve your items.

Another big change after level 20 is the ability to find Trinkets! These are powerful items that can be equipped in your bauble slots.

They come in three different colours,

.

You may equip one of each colour at any given time for a total of three trinkets.

Trinkets don't have durability, instead they have uses, or charges. They can be permanently used outside vaults without any cost, but they will use up one charge every time you enter a vault with one equipped. They can also not be unequipped inside a vault.

There is an
which gives you a random chance to not use a trinket charge when entering a vault.
Once you have found a trinket, it will be permanently discovered and can be crafted in the

.
A Crafted Trinket will always have 20 uses/charges, while a looted trinket randomly rolls 20 to 30 uses/charges.
Your first trinket is a reward of reading this quest, hopefully you get something you will like! If you don't, trinkets can be scrapped in the Vault Recycler, which yields their main ingredient:

.

The chance to get a Trinket Scrap is determined by how many uses/charges the trinket have left when being scrapped; A fully charged trinket will always yield the scrap, while a completely depleted one will never yield the scrap.
The world of Vault Hunters also hosts mystical

, some of them craftable, others only findable.

These

After level 20, while not playing Casual Mode, dying in a vault means that you either lose gold from having to buy back your spirit, or lose items if you don't buy back your spirit.

This can sometimes be both scary and frustrating, however, if you ever find yourself in a situation where you would like an insurance from death before entering a vault, craft yourself a

.

A Crystal created with this special rock grants you the
, insuring your items safety in case of death. The downside is that it will also
gained inside the vault, which can potentially be a positive in case you need to catch up!
is a great special vault rock in case you are feeling behind the scaling curve of the vaults. It
you get, including vault ores, but

from the vault.

This can be great to use in case you don't want to level up, but just want to loot more!
Now that you have become level 20 you will be able to find
are opened by right-clicking them with an empty hand, and have 3
, so make sure you carry some of it when entering vaults. The game will automatically combine bronze and silver in your inventory or in backpacks if needed to make the purchase. The
expertise can help lower the prices.
Open a Vendoor inside a vault
Dungeons are scary places inside the vault, containing a challenge and loot!
Dungeon Doors, found randomly inside the vault are opened by
them. Once opened, the dungeon will announce what

.

The mob head on the door itself tells you what type of mobs are guarding the dungeon.
, the larger the dungeon, the more loot and the higher the chance for an
, making it so that the dungeon monsters can't exit the dungeon, but don't worry you can walk through this

.
Tread carefully, and respect the difficulty! Good luck hunter!
Deep inside the dungeons you may find an

!

The two types of archives are the

.

These contain the ancient wisdom of
! When interacted with they will teach you a new modifier for either
and will allow you to modify your
or gear with more control and options!
is a new pedestal that will drop a piece of loot when interacted with.
: These pedestals will spawn in place of a

The Modifier Workbench allows you to craft guaranteed modifiers onto your gear giving you a large amount of control in terms of creating specific builds. Some modifiers unlock via leveling, however there are others that can only be unlocked by finding a Modifier Archive within dungeons!

The Wardrobe allows you to store a set of gear and a hotbar that you can quick switch between using the GUI. This enables having many different build sets to play with while allowing for much greater ease of access.

Just like the Wardrobe allows for storing gear, the Skill Altar allows for storing Abilities and Talents so that you can quick switch between different builds! This synergises exceptionally well with the Wardrobe.
The Transmogrification Table allows you to transmog gear pieces to any unlocked transmog you have acquired. Place a gear piece and some bronze to begin viewing transmogs!

be placed in the world anymore and instead must be placed in a doll juicer.

A juicer works in one of two ways.
1. The juicer can be supplied with power to quickly process the doll and spit contents into a storage container directly below.
2. The juicer can be used without power to slowly process the doll. You must use a hopper in order to obtain your items
: Early on, a small chest will work just fine, but as dolls become more and more stacked with loot, you may need to switch to a bigger storage solution.
The Jewel Pouch ID Table is a new block that will allow users to quickly open up jewel pouches. Once you click into the block, the interface is split into 3 sections.
: The middle is the selection area. Jewel pouches will be automatically moved here from the left side when empty. This is where decisions on which jewel you want will be made.
: The left side is where additionally placed/shift clicked unopened jewel pouches will go if the selection area is occupied.
: The right side is where jewels end up after a selection is made.
With this new station, the handling of jewel pouches can be faster and less overwhelming while also assisting with the de-looting process of vaults.
Craft A Jewel Pouch ID Table
The Jewel Purposer is a new vault workstation that has 2 purposes.

1. Store your jewels.

2. Apply those jewels to your tool based on weights that you choose on the left side of the UI.
: The Jewel Purposer will keep its inventory when broken.
By reaching level 40 you have made the Vault Gods aware of you!
The Gods are neither good nor bad, and you can make the choice to fully ignore them. However, they might prove worthy of your time!
Now that you've reached level 40, a couple more
are available that you can use to modify gear.
: This focus will re-roll gear implicits.
: This focus will re-roll the total repair slots of a gear piece.
: This focus will reset the crafting potential of a gear piece.
It is time you get familiar with the Vault Gods!
Neither good nor bad, they are;

. They can not be crafted.

Charms is your way to show your affinity to a specific god while inside a vault
. They can be identified by rolling them like gear, and there are four different tiers of charms;

The higher the tier, the more affinity they can have to their god.

Charms have uses, and can not be unequipped or equipped during a vault. A use charge is consumed every time you interact with a God Altar inside a vault.
Affinity is important to understand for your next quest, so, here is your first charm, identify it, and wear it proudly!
God Altars will start to appear in vaults after level 40.
The Altars represent one of the four gods.
Interacting with one of these altars inside the vault will give you a challenge by the god. Completing the task will give you a
, strongly buffing you in the vault and if you are lucky enough, and show enough affinity to the god, you can also gain a
with that God. But, beware! Failing the challenge will

!

Note, you can only reach 25 reptuation points in total, after that point you will lose reputation with another god, when gaining a new one.

With the God's now noticing you, a new vault objective is available.

Applying a Seal of the
to a crystal will change the objective of the vault to

.

To complete this objective, you will need to finish a certain amount of gold altars before exiting the vault.
This objective is very straight forward and can even be an alternative vault objective when reputation running (rep running).
Craft a Seal of the Zealot
Now that you know a bit about the gods and understand their altars, it's time to let you know about the
is a vault designed completely by you! It can be revisited once every day, and can be

to fully suit your needs.

In order to get started, you will need a
which you can place on a vault altar to create a
Each room is associated with a god, and will require you to have the sufficient
with that god to build. Every time you add a room of any god, the

from that god goes up.

The
of the Divine Paradox is empty in terms of loot and mobs, it exists solely for you to design and extend it,

Once you have built a few rooms in your Divine Paradox, it's time to run the vault!

You can do this only once every

, and since the Divine Paradox is a personal vault, you can not bring your friends.

The Divine Paradox starts out with
on the timer, as opposed to the 25 minutes of a regular vault.

can increase the time.

The goal of running your Divine Paradox is to collect

from each god, they appear in chests, coin piles and ores in a room blessed by the corresponding god. Collect the required amount and return to your start room to sacrifice them to the correct god to complete the Divine Paradox!
This will be difficult in the beginning, as you may not have enough rooms of each god to complete the vault, however, as you extend your Divine Paradox it becomes easier and easier to complete, and completing it is good, because the gods will always bless you with an

!

Once you have built a few rooms in the build realm of the Divine Paradox, craft a
and turn it in to a Paradox Vault Crystal by completing it on the Vault Altar.
If you ever feel like you want to

of your Divine Paradox, and start over, you can!

You will need a pool of
, and then simply drop an Architect's Divine Paradox Vault Crystal in it. This will void all progress and allow you to start over!
BEWARE, this does not refund any gold spent to unlock rooms!

quests.name: Craft a Hunt the Guardians seal

description.text: For this type of vault, the objective is to find obelisks, activate them, and kill the guardians that get summoned. Once you have activated enough obelisks, and killed the guardians, the vault is complete.
This objective has a recommended level of 40+ and will randomly appear in the vaults as well after that level.
Acquire a Seal of the Executioner

Reaching Vault Level 50 marks the halfway point in terms of levels, this means that you currently have half of your total expertise points already. The Neuralizer allows you to completely reset your currently specced expertise points in case you change your mind and decide that another expertise may suit your needs better!
objective to a crystal. To craft it you will need a blank seal and a few vault ingredients
The Bingo objective requires you to execute tasks on the bingo board and try to get a line completed. The rewards for this objective scale with the amount of lines completed.
Perform the task very quickly or it will reset. For example: Rapidly loot 10 wooden chests in 6 seconds
Perform the task without taking any damage(including poison and fall damage)
Deal no damage to any mobs whilst performing the task
Do not use any mana whilst performing the task
Perform a series of task within a timeframe, when you complete the first task it will change to the next
This objective has a recommended level of 50+ and will randomly appear in the vaults as well after that level.
Acquire a Seal of the Prophet
By reaching level 50, you will now gain access to the rest of the
needed to re-roll and modify gear pieces.
: This focus will randomly re-roll the tier of a random modifier.
: This focus will re-roll the prefixes while leaving the suffixes the same.
: This focus will re-roll the suffixes while leaving the prefixes the same.
: This focus will slightly improve a random modifier. This can be done indefinitely until a modifier is maxed out.
: This focus will freeze (permanently attatch) a random modifier to the gear piece. This can only be used once per piece and
: This focus will upgrade the tier of a gear piece by 1 stage.
a vault gear piece and make it no longer modifiable. The vorpal focus will do one of four things to the gear piece.
implicit will be added to the item.
implicit will be added to the item and the item will be completely re-rolled.
3. A random modifier will be increased to it's maximum tier, and then be upgraded by 1.

Another new feature introduced at level 50 is cards. They come in all different colors and varieties. You obtain them by finding booster packs in your completion crate or very rarely in your black market
This pack provides you with stat cards. They improve stats depending on their tier and any requirements
This pack provides you with resource cards. These cards add resources to your completion crate every time you fulfill their requirement
This pack provides you with a random set of cards
This pack provides you with arcane cards. These cards are especially powerful as they improve existing ability levels
This pack provides you with temporal cards. Temporal cards are some of the most powerful cards out there. These cards randomly play legendary modifiers in your vault
This pack provides you with wild cards. The perfect utility card. With these cards you can make card combinations a lot easier
This pack provides you with evolution cards. These cards are similar in function to stat cards but become more powerful if placed in specific spots in your deck
Some of these packs also have mega packs or shiny packs. You got to get them all!!
The Card ID Table is a new block that will allow users to quickly open up cards. Once you click into the block, the interface is split into 3 sections.
: The middle is the selection area. Cards will be automatically moved here from the left side when empty. This is where decisions on which card you want will be made.
: The left side is where additionally placed/shift clicked unopened cards will go if the selection area is occupied.
: The right side is where cards end up after a selection is made.
With this new station, the handling of cards can be faster and less overwhelming while also assisting with the de-looting process of vaults.
Now that you have some cards you might want somewhere to put them! Thankfully we've thought of something. Introducing the
. This handy item lets you bring cards into the vault and benefit from their special effects
They come in all shapes and sizes so keep a look out and you might just find one randomly.
Some cards might have special requirements before they work. Hover over them in the deck to see which cards are affecting your card.
The first deck is called Starter(in JEI)

You might wonder, What can I do with the cards that I don't like? Well wait no more. 

Introducing the
. Any card you don't like can be ground down to its essence. A tier 1 card can be upgraded to tier 2 with 10 essence. Watch out though. The higher the tier the more expensive the cost!
In order to use the machine, it needs a redstone signal. The card on the left will be juiced into essence. This essence can then be used to upgrade the card on the right.

!

They can be opened using a

of the same gem type that the door is made out of.
These keys are expensive and requires

as well as echo gems, but can be very worth it to make!

You start by making a
which you then combine with any legendary gem

Once you have a treasure key completed, bring it with you in to the vaults and search for a corresponding door, use the key on the door to open it.

Treasure Rooms contain a random amount of

!

 The pedestal will always contain a legendary piece of gear although the rarity of the piece will by Common+.

The Vault Loot Sack is a new piece of vault gear that is equipped in the off-hand slot.

Vault Loot Sacks only give modifiers pertaining to looting and you will forgo any offensive or defensive boosts.
Obtain a Unidentified Vault Loot Sack
The Vault Plushie is a new piece of vault gear that is used in the off-hand slot. Their implicits will consist of an

.

Their prefixes and suffixes can be a jumble of different combinations so you'll have to roll and experiment with them. Plus some of them are just adorable.

objective to a crystal.

As you would expect the goal of this objective is to fill up your elixir bar and escape by hitting a lodestone.  While you are filling up your elixir, random events will happen as your bar hits certain points.  These modifiers can help or hinder your vault and can range from a whole variety of things.
Oh and last thing, this objective may or may not be more fun with others.
This objective does not roll randomly and can only be applied with this seal.
Acquire a Seal of the Enchanter

The goal in this objective is to light the braziers while unhappy souls try to stop you.

The vault will always have the following 2 modifiers.
: Randomly spawned wraiths in the vault similar to the
: A percent chance to have time removed from the vault when hit by a mob.
The wraiths that spawn will have a relatively high resistance. Lighting the brazier will lower the resistance of the wraiths, deal a chunk of damage to them, and make them easier to kill.
This objective has a recommended level of 50+ and cannot roll randomly (can only be applied with a seal).
Acquire a Seal of the Exorcist

objective to the crystal.

Two things...

1. Take everything you thought you knew about scavenger vaults and toss it aside.

2. You're gonna need a bigger bag.

the goal remains the same. but with 3 slight changes.

1. Theres a lot.. a lot ... a lot of scavenger items in the game. In fact, it's almost like it's season 2 of VH all over again.

2. You'll need to obtain mob specific drops instead of mob essence.

3. The location for scavenger items has been re-configured.
This objective has a recommended level of 50+ and cannot roll randomly (can only be applied with a seal).
Acquire a Seal of the Psychopath

objective to a crystal.

Similar to

, the goal of this objective is to find obelisks and defeat the boss elites that spawn from them.

Oh also...these elites will have nasty effects and for every one you defeat, new modifiers will be added to the vault
This objective has a recommended level of 50+ and cannot roll randomly (can only be applied with a seal).
Acquire a Seal of the Titan
By reaching level 65, you've made it to the beginnings of mid-game and you can now start ascension vaults.
Upon reaching level 65 you unlock the possibility to craft a

.

This crystal can not be modified, and keeps track of your win streak (ascension). Every time you successfully complete a

, you increase the difficulty of the next Challenger's Crystal you run!

When you eventually fail (and you will), you will receive

, depending on how far you got.

.

is where you can spend your

for your gear, making you stick out as the Challenger you have become!
You can also purchase

titles for your nametag.

Make the world know that you know how to win!

objective to a crystal.

Considered to be the hardest objective in the game, complete bingo lines with a newly revamped system.

For each bingo line completed, additional modifiers will be added to the vault.

Oh, I should probably mention that the size of the bingo vaults has been altered to the following.

Due to how this objective can scale, the recommended level is probably around 80.

This objective cannot roll randomly (can only be applied with a seal).
Acquire a Seal of the Doomsayer
has accepted a certain number of
it will fall dormant. Occasionally it will wake up for 1 of 2 reasons.
1. To give a boost to the vaults for the day in exchange for a relatively large amount of

.It is recommended to work with others in order to obtain the submit all the crystals in order to obtain the boost.

2. To re-open border expansion in the same manner as before.

All of these event dates are pre-determined and more specifics about the events can be found in Discord.
No that you've hit level 90, you've reached the last parts of mid-game. No new things unlock, but the grind to level 100 and the start of end-game begins.

Reaching Vault Level 100 marks both the end of the initial vault leveling system, and early game. Now that you've reached level 100, new tasks and features will be available to you.  Feel free to check the quest book for more info.
Now that you're level 100 you have reached the beginnings of the end game and the new
are now consumable and will give you
. These points can be spent in the new

located next to the research tab.

The

contains a bunch of different player attributes that you can buy to permanently upgrade your character and ultimately change how you approach vaults.

For example, lets say you are a AP build that is reliant on spells.
Maybe you'll spend some points on
so that you can use the suffixes on your gear for something else.
There are so many options and it will be exciting too see what builds people come up with. Have a look around the menu to see whats available and begin the grind to truly max your character out..
You have completed all current available quests in Vault Hunters! More may be added in the future, so keep checking back here whenever you update your game!

Remember though, this questline is only the beginning, the overall goal of the game is to collect 25 unique artifacts, found very rarely in completion crates, as well as reaching level 100 and experiencing all the in-depth systems the game has to offer!
